title: Padá Mozilla
content: Dobrý den, dnes mi kompletně spadla Mozilla, zkoušela jsem podle nápovědy změnit nastavení i akutalizaci, ale nic nepomáhá. Jiné prohlížeče fungují, pády nastávají i v režimu řešení potíží. Ještě jsem neodinstalovala, to je až poslední možnost, protože je pár hesel, která si nepamatuju, a potřebovala bych se k nim dostat. Je ještě nějaká možnost, co se s tím dá dělat? Předem moc děkuji! Zuzana

title: Importing bookmarks via a Firefox account
content:
Hi,

I've recently moved PCs and I'm trying to import all my previous bookmarks to the new PC. The old PC was wiped completely to re-use the components in the new PC, however it was fully backed-up.

Previous to re-formatting everything, I made a Firefox account for easy bookmark transfer.

When I logged into the Firefox account on the new PC, no bookmarks synced. However, website history did sync.

In 'Settings > Sync > Manage Account', scrolling to the bottom of the page displays the name of my old PC, so Firefox does know that it exists. If all my bookmarks are stored in the cloud and not on my own hardware, why aren't they syncing?

Thanks for any help.
creator: Blazingfox

title: no youtube downloaders work....  actually disappeared even though supposedly still there...
content: My youtube downloader button disappeared entirely. So that downloader wouldn't work any more. And I couldn't find one to install that would work. All of this happened mysteriously mid session. Or perhaps between boots, I don't know. But I mean not that I know of because of anything I did with firefox and no great new instals or anything. I think firefox did it. It sometimes is suspiciously slow to come up.

title: No option to choose what to do when downloading .package files
content: I am having a problem where when I click on .package files to download them, I am always getting a pop-up box making me choose what to do with the file, and I am never given the option to 'always do this with this type of file' or anything. I went into settings hoping to make this change manually, but .package files were not in the list of content types I could set actions for - no matter what website I was downloading from. Additionally, during the same session, I downloaded a .zip file and DID have the option to check off downloading as a default action. I recently got a new computer and was expecting to have to reconfigure some things, but I can't figure out why I can't set a default for package files in particular. I download a lot of them as mods for the Sims, so this is very frustrating lol.

title: Amazon layout/fonts a mess following last updates
content:
Following the last 2 updates, Amazon's webpage does not appear to render correctly. I have checked with Safari (ugh) and Amazon appears normally with that browser. I myself had made no changes other than first one, than the second, update; I did the 2nd update immediately thinking it a fix for the Amazon problem and alas..... I am posting a screenshot as example..

I did attempt a troubleshooting tip a few moments ago from this site which involved choosing "set minimum font size to none" therefore reducing the text to something only readable by ants... Changing the preference to "allow websites to set font size" improved the ant-text, but not a whole lot.

title: Open tabs erased when I started session in a new device
content:
I have a personal laptop where I created a firefox sync account. In this device #1 I had open 17 tabs...

I got a new laptop and I installed firefox, then I signed in with my FF account to sync all my stuff from my personal laptop to this new device.. but tabs were not synchronized and also when I opened FF in my personal laptop the tabs were gone and the MAIN page was opened... Bookmarks are there but History don't have my recent 17 tabs in 'recently closed' and so they are gone... I thought having a sync account mean the OLD tabs were keep on one device and I can take them to a NEW one.. I'm so sad I lost my tabs... Please help me so this wont happen again
creator: karina.nava

title: Can't print from Firefox at all - Print Preview error or Stuck in Spooler - Windows 10 Pro x64
content:
For some time I have been totally unable to print from Firefox. I have the newest version that I know of, 93.0, running under Windows 10 64-bit, fully updated. I can print from any other browser and from all installed programs that I've tested to date. I even totally uninstalled Firefox and reinstalled from scratch. No help. I installed Firefox Portable and I have the same problem there.

One of two things happen when I try to print (even when I just try to Save to PDF): 1) the print manager says "Spooling" but never finishes the job. I can't clear the queue while 

   Firefox is running. When I exit Firefox, the job(s) clear out.

2) I get the error message: 

               Print Preview Error                An error occurred while printing.

I've tried to print using Print Using the System Dialog... choice. Same outcome. I've Google searched and have not found anything that helps. Reboots don't affect it. Again, I can print from virtually every other application including other browsers, no problems so it shouldn't be the Print Spooler service. If anyone has any ideas, please let me know. It would be much appreciated. Thanks much! I will post the resolution when (hopefully not If) I have it.
creator: jlseber
